p: Lipid peroxidation activity of aqueous suspension of roots was investigated by administration to mice and rabbits at a dose of 100 mg/kg after 6 hr intervals. The concentration of lipid peroxide was decreased in K. pneumoniae and S. aureus which advocated the prophylactic activity against stress induce lipid peroxidation ( 126). It was suggested that the anti-oxidant potential of withanolides might be due to the hydroxylated long chain of the carbon-bearing acyl group. Other compounds such as sitoindosides VII-X and withaferin A were investigated as potent initiators for free-radical scavenging enzymes, catalase, glutathione peroxidase, and superoxide dismutase in the striatum and frontal cortex of ratâ€™s brain ( 160).
